intro: Soldanella × wiemanniana, commonly known as the hybrid snowdrop, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant features a rosette of basal leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers on slender stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
